humanum_full_description_en:
From the " dog " to the sound of "爿". The original meaning is the appearance of a dog. "Shuowen": "Shape, dog-shaped. From dog, pan-sound." Duan Yucai's note: "Extension is shape. The extension like this is the same."

Bronze inscriptions were used as the names of people. In the seventeenth year, the prime minister enlightened him: "In the seventeenth year, the prime minister enlightened and made a state." Shang Yang Liang: "It is the prime minister's state and the state." Huang Shengzhang believes that " state " is a state. According to the Kui Zhuang, Kui Lin in the ancient books handed down, "Historical Records. "The Book of Emperor Qin Shihuang": "Prime Minister Wei Lin", Sima Zhen "Suoyin": "Kui's surname, Lin name. Those who have this work "Zhong" are not. Yan Zhi pushes the cloud: "In the beginning of the Emperor Kaihuang in the Sui Dynasty, the capital can wear the ground to cast The right of scale, the inscription, and the emperor's time measuring device at the beginning of the cloud, the prime minister and Wang Wan are listed, and they are written in the appearance of "Zhuang", written in season, and verified by the parents." Wang Shao also said. Proof of ancient times."

Warring States bamboo books " like " multi-writing "from the first ", " valves " sound of the word. Guodian Bamboo Slips "Lao Zi" A Slip 21: "You (you) [爿首] Chong Cheng." The handed down "Lao Zi" is "mixed with things", Qiu Xigui and Wang Hui thought that the word [爿首] means " zhuang " Variant, here refers to the meaning of things. Another example is the bamboo slips of the Bamboo Script of the Bo Chu "Rong Chengshi" 17: "A woman (like) is a Zhuang Ye ", the word also starts from " first ", "爿"

The " state " in the Qin slips can be faked as " suppression ", "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Slips. Japanese book A species. Jie Jiu Jian 36: "It's the god of justice in his room." The organizer reads it as " war ". "The god of justice " refers to the god of harm, and the whole sentence refers to the god of harm in his room.
humanum_short_description_en: From the " dog ", the sound of "爿". The original meaning is the appearance of a dog. The extension is the meaning of shape and appearance.
humanum_full_description:
從「犬」，「爿」聲。本義為犬的外形。《說文》：「狀，犬形也。从犬，爿聲。」段玉裁注：「引伸為形狀。如類之引伸為同類也。」

　　金文用作人名，十七年丞相啟狀戈：「十七年，丞相啟、狀造。」商鞅量：「乃詔丞相狀、綰。」黃盛璋認為「狀」即隗狀。按隗狀即傳世古籍中的隗林，《史記．秦始皇本紀》：「丞相隗林」，司馬貞《索隱》：「隗姓，林名。有本作『狀』者，非。顏之推云：『隋開皇初，京師穿地得鑄秤權，有銘，云始皇時量器，丞相隗狀、王綰二人列名，其作『狀』貌之字，時令校寫，親所按驗。』王劭亦云然。斯遠古之證也。」

　　戰國竹書「狀」多寫作從「首」，「爿」聲的字。郭店竹簡《老子》甲簡21：「又(有)[爿首]蟲成。」傳世本《老子》作「有物混成」，裘錫圭、王輝以為[爿首]字即「狀」的異體，這裏指物狀之義。另如上博楚竹書〈容成氏〉簡17：「女(如)是狀也」，字亦從「首」，「爿」聲。

　　秦簡中「狀」可通假作「戕」，《睡虎地秦簡．日書甲種．詰咎》簡36：「是狀神在其室」，整理者讀為「戕」，「狀神」指害人之神，全句指害人之神在他的房間。
humanum_short_description: 從「犬」，「爿」聲。本義為犬的外形。引申為形狀、狀貌之意。

從「 犬 」，「 爿 」聲。本義為犬的外形。《說文》：「狀，犬形也。从犬，爿聲。」段玉裁注：「引伸為形狀。如類之引伸為同類也。」 金文用作人名，十七年丞相啟狀戈：「十七年，丞相啟、狀造。」商鞅量：「乃詔丞相狀、綰。」黃盛璋認為「 狀 」即隗狀。按隗狀即傳世古籍中的隗林，《史記．秦始皇本紀》：「丞相隗林」，司馬貞《索隱》：「隗姓，林名。有本作『狀』者，非。顏之推云：『隋開皇初，京師穿地得鑄秤權，有銘，云始皇時量器，丞相隗狀、王綰二人列名，其作『狀』貌之字，時令校寫，親所按驗。』王劭亦云然。斯遠古之證也。」 戰國竹書「 狀 」多寫作從「 首 」，「 爿 」聲的字。郭店竹簡《老子》甲簡21：「又(有)[爿首]蟲成。」傳世本《老子》作「有物混成」，裘錫圭、王輝以為[爿首]字即「 狀 」的異體，這裏指物狀之義。另如上博楚竹書〈容成氏〉簡17：「女(如)是狀也」，字亦從「 首 」，「 爿 」聲。 秦簡中「 狀 」可通假作「 戕 」，《睡虎地秦簡．日書甲種．詰咎》簡36：「是狀神在其室」，整理者讀為「 戕 」，「狀神」指害人之神，全句指害人之神在他的房間。

狀字的基本解释

狀
zhuàng
见“状”。

狀字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zhuàng］
［《廣韻》鋤亮切，去漾，崇。］
“状1”的繁体字。
(1)形状；形态。
(2)指容貌。
(3)情状；情由。
(4)谓有事实依据；有迹象表明。
(5)功绩；善状。
(6)礼貌。
(7)陈述。
(8)形容；描绘。
(9)类似，好像。
(10)文体名。向上级陈述意见或事实的文书。
(11)指叙述人物生平行事的文字。汉以后多称为“行狀”。
(12)指褒奖、委任等文件。
(13)古代行状、书疏等结尾用语。
(14)指书信。
(15)通“藏”。参见“狀匿”。
(16)通“裝”。

狀字的康熙字典解释

【巳集下】【犬字部】　狀； 康熙笔画：8； 页码：页707第13
【唐韻】鉏亮切【集韻】【韻會】助亮切，?音?。【說文】犬形也。从犬，爿聲。　又【玉篇】形也。【易·繫辭】知鬼神之情狀。　又【韻會】形容之也，陳也。【莊子·德充符】自狀其過，以不當亡者衆。不狀其過，以不當存者寡。　又【史記·夏本紀】巡狩行視，鯀之治水無狀。【註】索隱曰：言無功狀。【戰國策】春申君問狀。　又【增韻】扎也。【正韻】牒也。

狀字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体韩国明朝体旧字形
狀字的起名意思

暂无。

shape
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［zhuàng］
["Guang Yun" hoe bright cut, go to Yang, Chong. ]
Traditional characters of "状1".
(1) Shape; form.
(2) Refers to appearance.
(3) Situation; reason.
(4) It is stated that there is a factual basis; there are indications.
(5) Merit; good status.
(6) Politeness.
(7) Statement.
(8) Describe; describe.
(9) Similar, like.
(10) The name of the style. A document for presenting opinions or facts to superiors.
(11) Refers to words that describe parallel events between characters. After the Han Dynasty, it is often called "Xing Zhuang".
(12) Refers to documents such as awards and appointments.
(13) Ancient concluding words such as adjectives and scribbles.
(14) Refers to letters.
(15) Through "Tibet". See "like hiding".
(16) Through "installation".
